function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Clinical staff using pulse oximeters can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly sanitized between uses.","Impact":"Increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases among clinical staff and patients.","Mitigation":"Ensure proper sanitization of pulse oximeters between uses, and provide training on proper use and sanitation procedures.","Technologies":"UV-C light sanitization devices, antimicrobial materials for pulse oximeters.","People":"Clinical staff, patients, healthcare workers.","Owner":"Healthcare facility management, equipment manufacturers."},{"Description":"Using consumer-grade wearables to measure students' anxiety and depression may lead to data privacy and security risks.","Impact":"Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive health data, potential for data breaches and misuse of personal information.","Mitigation":"Implement strong data encryption and security measures, obtain consent from students before collecting health data, and ensure compliance with data privacy regulations.","Technologies":"Data encryption, secure data storage, biometric authentication.","People":"Students, educational institutions, wearable device manufacturers.","Owner":"Educational institutions, wearable device manufacturers."},{"Description":"Rise in e-learning and use of IoT in smart learning increases the risk of cyber attacks and data breaches.","Impact":"Potential disruption of e-learning platforms, unauthorized access to student and teacher data, and compromise of educational resources.","Mitigation":"Implement strong cybersecurity measures, conduct regular security audits, and provide training on cybersecurity best practices for educators and students.","Technologies":"Firewalls, intrusion detection systems, encryption, secure authentication methods.","People":"Students, teachers, educational institutions.","Owner":"Educational institutions, IoT platform providers."}]}
